document.heading: Catlett Alley Designation Act of 2023

To designate a portion of the public alley system within Square 3015, bounded by Georgia Avenue, NW, Crittenden Street, NW, 9th Street, NW, and Buchanan Street, NW, as Catlett Alley, and to repeal a subject-to-appropriations clause.

history.summary: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced Bill 25-235 would designate the public alley system within Square 3015, bounded by Georgia Avenue, N.W., Crittenden Street, N.W., 9th Street, N.W., and Buchannan Street, N.W., in Ward 4, as Catlett Alley, N.W.

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Catlett Alley Designation Act of 2023".

section.text: Pursuant to sections 401 and 403, and notwithstanding section 421(f), of the Street and Alley Closing and Acquisition Procedures Act of 1982, effective March 10, 1983 (D.C. Law 4-201; D.C. Official Code §§ 9-204.01, 9-204.03, and 9-204.21(f)), the Council designates the portion of the public alley system within Square 3015, bounded by Georgia Avenue, NW, Crittenden Street, NW, 9th Street, NW, and Buchanan Street, NW, as "Catlett Alley".

codify:street-designation-anno.action: the Council designates the portion of the public alley system within Square 3015, bounded by Georgia Avenue, NW, Crittenden Street, NW, 9th Street, NW, and Buchanan Street, NW, as "Catlett Alley

section.text: Section 4 of the William Dorsey Swann Street Designation Act of 2023, effective July 20, 2023 (D.C. Law 25-28; 70 DCR 7914), is repealed.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement in the committee report as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.02(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
